description:
I got to San Francisco late morning after a red-eye flight and was recommended to check out this place. I immediately loved the atmosphere (you feel like you're in an Italian courtyard), was greeted by the very friendly staff and got various recommendations from the menu. I went with a slice of pizza and half a panini, which I got within minutes. Both were fresh and very tasty. 

I returned with someone else a little bit later and this place was buzzing with people. She got a soup and Cesar salad, both of which looked very yummy as well. Would have loved to come back again later but that didn't work out in the end.
author: Rico D.

description:
I brought the office team over for a Friday lunch. Arriving at 12:00, the line was still short and tables available. By 12:15, the line was to the door. So my advice is to try to go early.

The staff is very friendly. We all ordered something different. I think the best looking dish was the pasta with chicken and mushrooms and a cream sauce. The Vegetarian Lasagna was approved by the vegetarian in the group! I had the Penne Bolognese. The sauce was not as flavorful as I expected and I needed to add some pepper flakes to spice it up. The portions were a good size. A couple of people in our group couldn't finish their plates.

Overall rating 4 stars. 3 1/2 for the food and 4 1/2 for the ambience. The décor, music, and friendly staff make this someplace I would return to. I will try the pizza next time.
author: Marvin M.

description:
One of the best pizza places I've ever been to. When the office wanted pizza we went here. It is only one - two blocks away and always super crowded. The workers are so nice and friendly especially if they remember you! 

The pizza is amazing, I honestly always grab two slices for myself. Sometimes, I wish I grab a third slice. This place is awesome, you can't go wrong with this place for lunch or even for take out! I'm in love with this place.
author: Ann N.

description:
I've been to Tricolore Caffe & Catering a couple of times while visiting a customer nearby. Tricolore is your standard Italian restaurant with pizza, panini and a couple of pasta entrees. It has an online ordering link on their website that is a convenient option for ordering. During my first visit I got a slice of pizza and half panini combo ($8.95) to-go and went for the chicken pizza and salmon panini.

This is another restaurant in FiDi that has not signs for picking up online orders. Anyway the line starts from the left for ordering with the pay station to the right. For on-line orders you can directly head to the pay station which makes others waiting in line feel that you are cutting in line. A little more organization is warranted. During the first visit they were very busy so I had to wait another 10 minute to get my order.

The short review would be that the pizza and panini are both average at best. The pizza has a little too much oil which literally drips out of the foil and on to the paper bag. It is like a regular chain store bought pizza with a thick crust. The panini on the other hand was not heated (or toasted) even though I had asked for it to be while ordering. I was also not a very big fan of the bread that was used. It was tough and crumbly.

I decided to give them one more try. This time I got the Pesto pizza slice and chicken panini. This time they were not very busy and my order was ready when I reached about 20 minutes after ordering. Again the experience was the same. Oily pizza, dry bread for the panini. Pricewise this is about 30% cheaper than other lunch places in FiDi, but the quality shows in the food. If I'm around I'll stop by but Tricolore is not a candidate for my lunch rotation.
author: Ahmad J.

description: This place is adorable, but more importantly the food is delicious and fresh. Prices are reasonable too. Large portions! Def recommend going if you're in the area.
author: J J.

description: Good pastas and bomb clay oven pizza next to my work. I had raviolis bolognese and 2 slices of pizza and it was all great. The pasta was above average but the pizza is among the best iv had here in SF. Light crispy NY style with that clay oven char. Service is friendly and the interior is super cool it looks like the inside of an italian hobbits house.
author: Sean G.

description: Very very friendly service which gives them a bonus star because the food is probably just 3/3.5 stars but the guys here are so friendly and sweet!!! You can tell from their regulars and from their other reviews. I was taking a class at AcademyX nearby and was craving pizza. They have a bunch of lunch combo specials and I got the pizza and salad. Super affordable prices, quick service, everything you could ask for in a lunch spot :)
author: Tiffany V.

description: If I were paying for my lunch, this is probably my favorite restaurant in the area. Its a like a family italian restaurant and all the people are nice. It has this cozy feeling and the prize is reasonable especially when I am paying for my lunch. I love the pasta, the pizza and the tirAmisu.
author: Mel E.

description:
Very basic menu with healthy options here: salads, sandwiches, soups, fruit salad and more. 

- MIXED GREENS CHICKEN SALAD: $10.28 and came with focaccia. Salad itself wasn't spectacular, but was plentiful and made with very fresh ingredients (loved the fresh firmness of the cherry tomatoes). What could've made it great, was a great dressing -- was quite heavy on the balsamic unfortunately.

- PIZZA: $7 for two slices. not a huge fan of the crust, which tasted more to me like focaccia than pizza dough crust.


Very very friendly and quick service, with tables to sit both inside and outside.
author: Kristie C.

description: Amazing food! We ordered pasta and pizza...both tasted so good..so delicious...in short just YUM!
author: Nivya G.

description: You can get individual slices of pizza for lunch without breaking the bank or waiting for more than 10 minutes. What more could you want? I love the rotating selection of pizza, and the crust is perfect!
author: Christina S.

description: Great people, great coffee, great slice of pizza, Greta prices, great ingredients, what more could you really want. Did I mention great people?
author: Ritwik S.

description: Been here a few times. The lasagna seems to be the best thing on the menu. I'd definitely keep coming back for it. The rest seems like a pass though. I had a chicken panini the other day. Bread tasted stale and the chicken was very dry. Salads don't seem especially tasty either.
author: Michael S.

description:
Even though I think the food is average, I would not mind becoming a regular here. Everyone who works here is super nice, and they actually take the time and effort to get to know their customers. I met up for lunch with my friend, and he suggested this place since it's right across the street from his office. I got here a little early to answer emails, so I got a small cup of black coffee to keep me company.

There are so many delicious-sounding options on the menu to choose from. Perhaps next time I'll have to try a hot entree, but this time I settled with the sandwich and salad combo. My sandwich contained mozzarella, basil, and tomatoes. On the side, I got the Tricolore pasta salad. To be honest, both were kinda tasteless and not very filling. I couldn't finish my food, so I ended up giving it to a homeless person. At least it didn't go to waste! Supposedly.

Anyways, it's clear that the food here is made with the freshest homemade ingredients. It's relatively inexpensive. The service is fantastic. They even do catering! There's so much to love about Tricolore Caffe, including their good intentions, so I would be willing to give this place another try in the future.
author: Stefanie C.

description: We ordered some Italian food (catered) from here a couple days ago and it was a big hit! I kept seeing my coworkers going back for seconds and taking leftovers home. The lasagna was amazing, we got a meat one and a veggie one. We also ordered cheese ravioli, salad and fruit salad. I like that this food tastes very authentic and the service was great too! I would definitely order from here again, I highly recommend it :)
author: Gabriela S.

description: Really good pasta, healthy portions. I went around 1:00pm on a Wednesday- there was not a lot of people in there. I did order takeout online just to be cautious . But is did seem like that was necessary. I will definitely keep them in my lunch rotation.
author: Leslie W.

description:
I had Michael cater my engagement party (around 45-50 people) on April 2nd. I was so glad I went with Tricolore!  I had been searching for an in between type of catering -- not full-service, but also not just drop off.  We needed warmers and someone to set up the food but not the full service.  I struggled to find a middle ground and Tricolore was just right. 

We went in to sample the food and Michael was very gracious and we set up a menu right there for the following Sunday -- lasagna, ravioli, salad, antipasto, tortellini.  It was all solid, good food.  My mom wanted a cuisine that would appeal to everyone and this was just right --
 not super strong flavors, filing, solid. I got nervous as Sunday approached and tried to assuage my irrational fear that we would run out of food by asking Michael to add more food onto the menu.  With a lot of honesty and candor, he assured me that he didn't want to charge me more money unnecessarily and that we would have more than enough.  Even so, a day before, I panicked and added two more dishes.  Michael was right of course and we had so much left over but we were able to take it home so it's ok.  

He was very prompt in dropping off the food and setting it up at the venue and even picked it up the same day (a huge relief).  I definitely recommend Tricolore for a party or event.
author: Rose F.

description: I was in San Francisco for business and came upon this little place for lunch. The food was delicious. I had pizza, Caesar salad, and the cucumber/tomato salad on different days. And I loved them all. More than that though was the amazing service. The staff were so friendly and even remembered me when I came in the following day. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a quick lunch spot! Cute inside, too.
author: Yvonne N.

description:
What a cute little Italian deli!  I've had this place bookmarked for some time now, and finally checked it out on a rainy lunch break.  We popped in for a quick lunch.  Luckily for us the rush hadn't started yet (around 11:30 am or so).  We were able to walk right up to the counter and order.  Our food was ready in about a 3-5 minute wait.  

The nice thing about a quick lunch here is the combo options. Customers can pair salads, pizza slices, painis, and soup to accommodate a unique lunch. I went with a salad and a slice of cheese pizza.  My coworker ordered a panini and a salad.  The pizza slice was ok- not the best I've had (I'm sooooo loyal to Tony's!) and the salad was fresh and delicious.  The panini was a generous size.  

I will certainly be back.  Check the menu online (http://www.tricoloresf.com/)  for the daily specials-- apparently Tricolore offers a daily soup, daily pasta salad, and a daily pasta.   I've already spotted a few soups and pasta dishes I'd like to try.
author: Andrea H.

description: Conveniently located very nice amenities simple menu decent prices I would highly recommend any time. Awesome locks and bagels....
author: D. M.

description:
Had the veggie pizza which comes with artichoke hearts and spinach and mushrooms. Crunchy thin crust. Warm but not too hot which is good  because I was able to blow on it once and eat it up. Delish! We ordered two slices and two Snapple. Came out to $12 and a couple cents. 

No complaints about the food or the service.
author: E A.

description:
I don't come here as often as I'd like but whenever I do, I'm greeted with a warm smile and the smell of pizza coming through the oven! 

I'm a sucker for Panini's in general, but their Salmone Panini is hands down my absolute favorite. 4 simples pieces that come together to make such a decadent taste. 

In general, you can't go wrong with anything here. So many opportunities for combinations, whether its, half panini, a slice, a cup of soup, or a small salad, the combinations are endless! 

Tricolore, keep up the delicious work!
author: Maria Francesca A.

description: Worked with Michael to get an office catering order done. He was very easy to work with. Prices and portions were great and food was delicious. Drop off and set up were prompt and seamless. thank you again!
author: Donna H.

description: Tricolore is on my regular rotation of places near the office to get a great lunch.  The minestrone soup is great on cold SF day and pasta specials are yummy and filling. Fresh ingredients and a friendly staff. Magnifico!
author: Robert G.

description: I ate here two days in a row this week. I got a Chicken Panini which they made fresh for me even though it was 3:05pm and they close at 3:30. There was a single Prosciutto one in the fridge and everything else besides pizza was gone so they were starting to clean up. Their panini sandwiches are made with focaccia bread and it's not oily nor dry. I liked it a lot. On the second day, I had a slice of Chicken Pizza with Caesar Salad and I added a small Turkey Pasta Salad. The pizza was tasty. Just a single slice is only $3.95. Since I got the salads, my total was about $15. Three salads of your choice is $8.95. Their prices are fairly low and especially for the Financial District. They're really nice at this cafe. My office has ordered for the office and they are very accommodating. When it's been too heavy to carry back, they offer to have someone help us deliver it. Everything we've eaten has been good.
author: Jen L.

description: I used Tricolore for the first time for a small event and it was delicious.  I love their red meat lasagna and their cheese tortellini with marinara sauce.  The group really enjoyed the meal.  I even had seconds!  I am looking forward to trying their other dishes too.  Michael was a great help.  Thank you Michael!
author: Eva S.

description: Great service.  Had a salad and a slice of pizza which was pretty good.  The calzone looked delicious and will be definitely on my list to try.
author: John B.

description:
I haven't actually ever stepped foot into this place, but my office has ordered pizzas from Tricolore 3 times now and we have yet to be disappointed! The thin crust pizzas are delicious and crispy. It's so hard not to keep going back for more slices!

We usually order 3-4 extra large pizzas, and it is definitely more than enough to put our whole office into a midday pizza coma. Over the phone the staff is very friendly and helpful. They even gave us a bit of a discount which is super nice of them. They deliver the pizzas right to our office exactly at the scheduled time, and it's perfectly hot and fresh tasting every time.

We originally used to order from the Pizza Orgasmica at Embarcadero, but after one bad customer service experience there we decided to check out Tricolore instead. It was a great move! The pizzas taste much more authentic. Simple, quality ingredients and not too overloaded or crazy. My favorites that we've ordered are the Tricolore (low fat ricotta, mozzarella, tomatoes and basil), rustica (sautéed mushrooms, prosciutto, garlic and oregano) and the al pesto (low-fat ricotta and mozzarella, pesto and sun dried tomatoes).

If you're having an office party or just want a pizza fix in the FiDi, i would def recommend Tricolore!
author: Evelyn S.

description: I LOVE this place. The best breakfast and lunch in the financial district. The owner Michael has been in this location, providing fresh organic food/drink for a couple of decades. Great atmosphere, great clientele. I always enjoy a visit to Tricolore.
author: Rachel P.

description: Worked with Michael to get an office catering order done. He was very easy to work with, prices and portions were great, and food was delicious. Drop off was prompt and seamless. Thank you!
author: Donna H.

description:
One of my go-to restaurants in fidi when I want some fast, fresh italian food! This place is actually really good and I'm so glad one of my co-workers introduced me to it. 

I mostly get the half salad, half soup combo with the tricolore pasta salad and the minestrone soup. The pasta salad is a traditional italian pasta salad with mozzarella and cherry tomatoes. The minestrone soup is a good hearty soup with a tremendous amount of vegetables. I've also tried the mozzarella and tomato panini, but I wasn't a huge fan of it - it was kind of dry and fell apart easily. 

Their prices are great and their staff is extremely friendly! 

I really want to come back and try their pizza and pasta dishes as well but I will always be back for their salad and soup combo!
author: Malika R.

description: Amazing food quick and friendly service! Loved my salad, it probably would have been enough alone but I couldn't resist the meat lasagna! Really good.
author: Julie W.

description: I am giving this a one star review because of how uncomfortable I felt. I am currently working nearby and this is the third time I have been here for lunch. The food has never failed to disappoint me until today. First of all when I went to order I noticed that one of the cooks behind the counter was staring at me and smiling at me in an unsettling manner. I tried to ignore it hoping it would stop, but as I stood waiting for my order it continued. I then noticed that the two other cooks present had congregated and began speaking to each other in Spanish. I could make out only a few words since I was standing so far away. What I did hear was not at all what any young woman would want to hear. When my food was finally done the same cook who was initially staring at me called out my name to announce that my order was ready. When I picked my food up I tried to  avoided any and all eye contact out of pure discomfort. I left feeling uneasy and when I arrived at my office to eat my panini I noticed that they had gotten my order wrong. If they would have spent less time staring at me and saying inappropriate comments, maybe my order would have been made correctly. I will not be returning.
author: Miranda B.

description:
4 stars for their pizza (pepperoni and mushroom). For less than $5 post taxes, you get thin crusted, cheesy, slice that's reheated in the oven. Affordable when you are low on cash. Friendly service. Dine in, sit outside on nice days, or to-go. My go-to for pizza!

I don't care for their caeser salad (soggy and salty) or butternut soup (not to my liking).
author: Hmmm O K.

description: I come here often for lunch and their pasta is amazing!!! A little pricier for lunch, but a huge plate of pasta that you can enjoy and have some leftovers! The owners are very sweet, and always remember you (if you come as often as I do!)
author: Mandi R.

description: This is one of my favorite lunch and breakfast places tucked away in San Francisco's Financial District. Fresh, delicious pastas, pizzas, soups, paninis, etc. Their portions are generous and feel very healthy. The staff greet you with a smile and are very friendly. I recommend you try their great cappuccino and tiramisu for a special treat, yum! Two thumbs, way up!
author: Mavid S.

description:
We ordered here for a company lunch (they delivered). Everyone absolutely loved the food.
Everything was fresh and authentic. They even made a special meat lasagna for us. The calzones were amazing. We will be a return customer!
author: Anna F.

description:
I've been here twice and both times it has just been okay. The pizza isn't fresh and they re heat your pieces as you order it - not ideal.  The pizza isn't very good and doesn't taste like much - even a bit soggy in my opinion. 

However, the prices are good so if you need a cheap lunch this is your place.
author: Jacqueline M.

description: Came across this restaurant by chance during lunch. Great pizza spot - I got a slice of the Rustica & a slice of the Michele. Also got a cup of the Caffe Mocha. Will definitely be returning again!
author: Calina N.

description:
Met up w/ Yelp buddy Simone W for a sunny-workday lunch & couldn't have been more impressed w/ Tricolore

Choices consisted of the Veggie & Turkey Panini - was declared delish

I chose the half Mozzarella Panini w/ a bowl of the White Bean-Tomato Soup

The soup was so filling & the sandwich was so toasty & melty w/ the soft mozz that before I knew it, I had polished off my whole meal.....& had the muffintop belly to prove it

I also got some of their freshly baked, homemade Zucchini Bread for later & it was uber-yummy.  Soft & moist & spicy bread w/ a crunchy cream cheese-like topping, this was the perfect Fall weather treat

Will certainly come back - there are loads of other combos I'm looking forward to trying!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
One to like.

Second visit prompted by a coupon for free coffee with the purchase of any food item to celebrate their new Facebook page. So far 68 likes: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Tricolore-caffe-pizzeria/1422315274673309

Best part of the Americano was that it was free and a generous two shots. Mr. Espresso beans again proved to be on the bitter side.

Fortunately there was more to like such as an outstanding muesli with blueberries, strawberries, oats and lowfat plain yogurt. Sweet and filling and just $3 for a small.

Tiramasu also gets a Mark Zuckerberg-approved thumbs up. Rich and fluffy with a perfect cocoa sprinkled top, it was meant for later but couldn't resist a bite or three now.

Staff continued to exhibit a genuine mix of warmth and enthusiasm. Their endearing attitude combined with great food make it easy to like everything.
author: Jason B.

description: Staff is always quick, attentive and friendly. I requested an item not listed on their menu and they were able to deliver and it didn't lack of size or flavor. Great prices for good food.
author: Monica B.

description: I've been a regular here for the past 5+ years and needed to sing my praise of the Tricolore crew. I highly recommend the slice of vegetarian with bowl of minestrone or tomato white bean combo. Always quick and delicious. It's a hidden gem in the Financial District.
author: Marcel B.

description:
WEE!!!

One of my go-to places for lunch :)
Everyone who works here is super nice and there is always a bunch of regulars here (good sign!)

Traditional italian fare made WELL and at reasonable prices. Always super fresh.

There are always seats open and outside seating area as well. I like sitting here by myself sometimes, or it's a great place to talk and eat too. Casual atmosphere.

I LOVE their pesto and I get their soup instead of going to the Soup Company.. I don't like chains and this place is actually CHEAPER than if you go to the Soup Company. Plus you know it's homemade and fresh.

Num num. Their pasta is authentic and I can't wait to try everything else.. Portions are great too. I always come when I have a craving for pasta.
author: Emily C.

description: I have been coming here for the passed 20 years and have loved every bite of pizza I have ever taken. The pizza , the pastas, the salads and desserts; all amazing !!!! Highly recommend !! If I could give Tricolore 6 stars I would !!
author: Salvatore A.

description: Average pizza and salad. Maybe it was just a wrong choice. Tried Al Pollo Pizza and Senza Culpa Pizza. Al Pollo Pizza is slightly better than the other one. Della Casa salad is probably not worth getting, unless all you want to eat green leaves. But it could be a great choice. Depends what you are looking for.
author: Svetlanko I.

description:
My new lunch place.  Happy that they sell pizza by the slice!

Check out their combo specials! Most if not all under $10 - slice + salad, salad+soup, 2 slices, etc.  All very good deals.

I had 2 slices (veggie with no cheese and sweet sausage with mushrooms) for about $7 and it was delicious. 

It's hard to find decent lunch options nearby so this is good to know if you're in the area.
author: Lisa K.

description: This is by far my favorite lunch spot in Financial District/ Jackson Square. The food is incredibly fresh and healthy, the ingredients are high quality, and it really is authentic Italian style cooking. They have new specials of pasta dishes and soups every day, as well freshly prepared salads, sandwiches and pizza. I'm a big fan of their pizzas and insalata della casa. Above all- they have the friendliest staff in San Francisco! I end up coming here every week, or several times a week, because the food is so delicious and the people are so terrific- it can't be beat!
author: Maya M.

description:
(See pics)

More of 3.5 stars.

I needed my Italian fix and this is a good takeout place that is fast with good food. This time I got linguine with tomatoes and mozzarella, and it was pretty good, though I wish they were cherry tomatoes.

The salad dishes did look very look and will have to give it a try next time.
author: T L.

description:
Delicious, and very reasonably priced. Wonderful staff as well, they are super friendly and efficient!

What's more, they have slices of yummy cheese-free pizza, which is awesome for the dairy-intolerant folks like me :)
author: Carolyn C.

description:
I really appreciate business owner's who CARE about their customers, in addition, take the time to reach out to them and take the criticism constructively and offer suggestions to remedy the issue.  Such as Claudia - who reached out to me today and offered to make it up to me.  

So what did I learn today - if I want something - ask for it.  

That is, when ordering be clear about how or what I want.  Think of Sally in "When Harry Met Sally" - when it came to ordering her food, as annoying as she was, she was unabashed in explaining to the server EXACTLY what she wanted and how she wanted it.

I guess I forget I too can ask/make inquiries leading to what I can expect, or how I would like it.  

Silly me.
author: Cris B.

description:
I have to update my review because the owners of Tricolore read my previous review and personally contacted me about it. They apologized profusely for the poor customer service and meal I was served and they offered to make it up to me. I was very touched since I've left several negative reviews for other businesses before and this was the first time that one of them has ever cared enough to contact me about it. I really like business owners who prove that they actually care about their customers. 

So I went in today and requested something low-carb since I was recently diagnosed as a diabetic. They offered me the minestrone soup and a grilled chicken sandwich, which I devoured in one sitting. The entire meal was DELICIOUS! I wasn't able to eat my soup for 30 minutes and to my pleasant surprise, it was still pretty warm when I finally got to eat it. Not only that, it was very tasty and fresh so I'm thinking I just found a new favorite soup. Lol. The salad was also very fresh and well-made with good quality ingredients. Yep, I'd definitely go back and eat there now!

So now I have to give Tricolore 5 stars, both for their yummy food and awesome customer service. :-)
author: Jessica C.

description: Bad pizza - in fact, I think mine may have been undercooked? Was doughy and tasted bad. I didn't like the pizza sauce, either. Salad was fraught with dressing - it literally dripped. Would def not recommend.
author: Jill C.

description:
Tricolore Caffe did some catering for my office earlier this week, and did a fine job.  Their salads were especially delicious -  the fusilli salad was gobbled up before I even had a chance to taste it.  I did manage to grab some marinated vegetables, which included zucchini, peppers and mushrooms - and they were garlicky and oily, just what I wanted.

I will make a slight criticism of the pannini.  They were pretty skimpy on the fillings (except the grilled veggie) and there was no spreads on the sandwiches - no mustard, mayo or anything, which made them a little dry.  Fortunately we keep a fridge well stocked with condiments so we customized the pannini the way we liked them.

We will definitely use Tricolore again!
author: .Hon H.

description: This is a great cozy lunch spot right near the Pyramid. The soups and salads are excellent. The pizza and pasta too. It's fast, it's comfortable. They are friendly and the prices are reasonable. Everything is made in house. Very responsive to companies that need catering for events and meetings, too. Not a chain or remote owner. Very personal. Mike owns and operates the place and is always happy to chat with customers and make them feel at home and see that they are happy with the food and the service. Cool decor.
author: Bill S.

description: One of the first lunch places that I visited after relocating to Chinatown area. I got a combo with a half chicken penini and a salad - both tasted great. In short great place with plenty of healthy items on the menu topped with friendly service!
author: Artur R.

description:
chicken panini

It was a very basic sandwich. While I realize traditional paninis are not pressed, this sandwich would have been much better if it had been pressed and if it included cheese. The sandwich was simply too basic to stand out. It wasn't bad. There was just nothing special to make it different or better than any of the other sandwich shops. Since it is close to my office, I may return and try a pasta dish or pizza.
author: Mark D.

description:
Though Italian food isn't the first cuisine that comes to my mind when I think of vegan food, but this place is a little exception. For a fi-di lunch place, they usually have a couple of vegan options. I found vegan soups almost every time I went there. Somedays I will even find a vegan pizza. How wonderful is that! 

Space-wise it is a bit tight and sometimes you might have to wait a min or two before you can order. But over all my experience here has been positive. 

Taste 3.5/5
Quality 4/5
Price 4.5/5
author: Rohit N.

description:
This little place has some great selections and pretty good deals for lunch. I had the vegetariano panini with the insalata penne pasta salad. I think this is the first vegetarian sandwich I've ever had and I have to say "who needs meat?" lol. I was a bit if-fy about trying it, but zucchini and mushrooms just sounded so yummy to me (i've been eating a lot of vegetables lately). 

The foccacia bread is so soft and lite that it doesn't overpower the sandwich. Equal amounts of everything made it a nice lite lunch treat. For half a sandwich and salad, it was $9, a little steep, but really filling for my tummy. A few bites of half the sandwich and salad already satisfied my hunger. I'll have enough for lunch even tomorrow!
author: Quinallison D.

description:
Contrary to other reviews, I enjoyed Tricolore's pizza.  We decided to eat here for lunch and opted for a fresh baked whole margherita. It look about 20 minutes, but it was piping hot and fresh! 

Right across the street from the Transamerica building, this tiny location is a great lunch place whether you're dining alone or with six. This would be a place I'd eat at again.
author: David O.

description: A solid lunch place for soups, salads, pizza and pastas. My favorites are chicken caesar salad, any of the soups and their pasta bolognese. You can eat there inside, or outside at 2 tables or take your food and eat it in the enchanting Transamerica redwood forest across the street.
author: Rob K.

description: We went here for lunch on a Monday. It was not crowded at all and we were easily seated. I had the combination of a one half Panini with chicken and the minestrone soup. They were both very good.  Service was also good.  Overall, a good place for a quick lunch.
author: Susan P.

description: I got half a salmone panini and a soup, the lentil tomato one. OMG the soup was absolutely delicious and I finished it ALL. I rarely do that unless I really like the soup. It was not salty AT ALL. Very pleased with the salmon panini, it was just right with not too many ingredients but just the right amount of salmon with a nice mascarpone spread. Such an unassuming place this is with good fresh ingredients. Next time I'll try the pizza, two slices for $7 and you can get a slice and half a panini too. A full panini is huge by the way, half of one is enough. The pasta salads look good too. I will be back and refer our Office Manager to them for catering as well.
author: Gina R.

description:
I've worked a block away from this joint for a year and never really had any co-workers talk it up.  With a $3 LevelUp credit I finally gave it a shot today for lunch take-out.  If watery pasta and a 6 to 1 noodle to sauce ratio is your thing then then you've got to check this place out.  I honestly don't think they took the 30 seconds needed to drain the pasta and they rationed out the sauce as if there was a tomato famine going on.  

I'm told the panini's are ok but after my initial experience it will take an $8 LevelUp credit to get me back in there.  My word is my bond.
author: Brad B.

description: I was craving Italian for lunch. I found this great little place at the foot of Columbus. The veg panino and a proper bowl (not cup)  of minestrone hit the spot.  I also like how they use your name, not a number.
author: Gary W.

description:
I used to work kitty corner from this place in what I affectionately refer to as the "Tommy Toy Building" (655 Montgomery).  

Tricolore has great pizza, great salads (the Mediterranean is my personal favorite) and great sandwiches.  Even when it is busy, getting in and out of here is pretty fast.  

The only thing I haven't tried that needs to be tried is the gelato.  Judging by how they do everything else here, it's going to be GREAT.
author: Nelson W.

description: I liked this place better before but in recent visits it's not been as good. The soups and special dishes are always fantastic but the sandwiches they keep on their counter are always cold, rancid, and soggy in the inside. I always feel bummed out when I've spent money for a lunch that it will be thrown away :( I don't think I will be going back for a sandwich here.
author: Karla D.

description:
If you happen to be near the financial district and are looking for a place to eat lunch, it is well worth the short walk! I have been going there at least once a week with a bunch of friends for the last couple of years and am enjoying it every time.

This is a great little Italian restaurant right across from the Pyramid building. I have been there many times and really enjoy the food, atmosphere and service. You can even eat outside and enjoy the midday sun. 

I have tried almost all of the items on the menu and have been extremely pleased. They have a great selection of fresh salads, authentic Italian pizza and pastas. If you are into desserts like me, you must try the amazing homemade tiramisu along with a cup of cappuccino! 

I especially like the friendly staff which is always upbeat and very friendly!
author: Chris K.

description:
Nice and close.
Today I had the 1/2 pannino: prosciutto, fresh mozzarella cheese on a light piece of foccacia bread. A side of lentil/tomatoe soup and a slice of pizza
with salami, cheese and tomatoe sauce. All pretty good, total price $10.85 Ok, I ate a lot today. Needed the fuel for tonites voting.
Will be going back.
Customer service: fine.
Decor: different and italian-ish. Small place , lively atmosphere.
author: Bert K.

description:
Here we gooo...value!
Here we gooo...consistency!
Here we gooo...efficiency!
Here we gooo...tastiness!
Here we gooo...quality!
Here we gooo...cleanliness!
Here we gooo...friendliness!
Here we gooo...proximity!

My lunch "rock" 3-4x/week for seven years and counting...
author: Chris D.

description:
This is the place to go if you want something quick with pretty good sized portions.  The line, if there is any, moves pretty quickly.

I've only ever had their 2 salad combinations so I can only speak to that.  I've tried the pasta salad with tuna and capers a couple of times and it's pretty good - very flavorful.  I've also had their Mediterranean salad which is a combination of cucumbers, tomatoes, and feta cheese.  That's also pretty tasty, but the vegetables are very roughly cut (huge pieces!)  I wouldn't recommend the salad with zucchini, roasted red peppers and mushrooms...I got that once and the zucchini and mushrooms were hot and the roasted peppers were refrigerator cold...very odd combination.

Overall, good price, nice portions and a combo of 2 salads of your choice comes with 2 pieces of bread for under $7.
author: Alvina W.

description: The best decaf coffee in my neighborhood :)  Michael, Joe and their crew are always very friendly.
author: Dana W.

description:
This is one of my favorite lunch spots in the financial district!  I wish it wasn't so far from my office - or I would probably go there every day.

It's a cute, little Italian café with really sweet Italian guys who run it, and they have awesome soups, salads, pastas, pizza, and my favorite - grilled paninis!

They have minestrone soup every day which is deeeeelicious (their special white bean tomato soup is up there too), and then I also always get their grilled mozzarella tomato panini which is amazing - the mozzarella is so fresh and creamy.  They have a wide variety of paninis, and they are all super tasty.

I love their combo options - I always get a cup of soup and a half panini for only $6.25, pretty sweet deal if you ask me - especially considering how good the food is.  

The pizzas and pastas I have had are also excellent, as are the salads.

Great food, great service, great prices.  Rare find in the financial district.
author: Sandra M.

description:
Great lunch spot in the back of Fidi right across from the Transamerica Building.  

Great selection of salads, soups, panini's, pizza, coffee and more.  Totally affordable prices for a decent portion.  I always go for their combo of a salad or soup and a panini.  Yum!  The owner is a total sweetheart (always so friendly and welcoming) and the staff is just as friendly.

Very cute little Italian cafe!
author: Carmen Y.

description: always on godish which is great. their insalata con pollo is amazing. nicest guys ever work there.
author: Sonya Z.

description: Pretty average place with pretty good prices.  I had the Mozzarella panini - half, and half is truly tiny.  The bread for the panini was pretty good, and my coworkers seemed to like the pasta, but not the pizza.
author: Joyce H.

description:
I love this place. First time to come for lunch. It's not crowded and have a nice Italian atmosphere. The food is fresh and cheap. The combo menu is only  between 5.50 - 7 where you can get a combination of 2 of soup/salad/sandwich/pizza. Healthy light lunch.

Will come back to try other stuff.
author: Di J.

description: Ordered two pizzas today for the office and they were a huge hit!  Definitely the place to order pizza if you work in the FiDi area.
author: Katniss B.

description:
This place is O-K.  They have some great combo options that are inexpensive, but I wasn't impressed with the food.  The proscuitto panini hardly had any meat and the bread was not the best bread for a panini.  I also had the tricolore salad (with goat cheese and grape tomatoes) and it was less than par.  

I agree with Jon N......I wish it was better because the location is great.
author: Megan H.

description:
I was fiending some pizza and this is the closet place to my work. $3.85 for a small/medium sized slice, soggy crust and pretty greasy. 

I guess the positive was it tasted like pizza and satisfied my craving, but other than that it sucked. I would never go back for the pizza.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
It was raining and this was right across from my building so I thought it would be quick and easy to grab some pizza. 

I walked up to the counter, and since I saw they already had half a pepperoni pizza sitting right there, I ordered a slice of that. Not sure why I had to wait another 15 minutes after I ordered before they actually gave me a slice since it was sitting right there. This is the greasiest pizza I've had in SF, my stomach already hurts and I used two entire napkins blotting up the grease. 

I might have a different opinion if I'd tried the pasta or maybe fruit salad, which looked pretty fresh. 

Note: this is not the place for a special order on pizza slices or a sandwich as it's all pre made.
author: Beth D.

description: The pasta is absolutely delicious.  The pizza is just okay.  The guys there are always friendly and ask how you're doing.  They turn and burn pretty quickly and it's good for a take-out lunch or to grab a slice of pizza.
author: Annie C.

description:
I've been coming here for about 7-8 years now, and have yet to write a review.  The food here is very fresh, made with care and great ingredients.  It certainly has a lot of character, unlike a lot of other downtown lunch spots.  I'm not sure what ethnicity the staff is, but I am going to imagine Italian.  Each of the pasta dishes are unique.  The pizza doesn't look as good in the case, but once they heat it up, it's good.  But I'd go for one of the made to order pasta specials if you want something a little more custom.

Prices could be better, but aren't ridiculously out of line.
author: Jon S.

description:
Tricolore, you never let me down. 
You are my new best friend.

You are like the dressing tossed in my salad, 
the half and half stirred in my coffee,
and the jeans on my bottom half.

You are fresh and delicious any time and every time I meet you at lunchtime. Pastas, pizzas, soups, salads, deserts. Italian heaven, and quite affordable. Can we pinky promise to be BFF????
author: Geneva X.

description: Had the penne salad with artichokes, sun dried tomatoes and what appeared to be bits of turkey cold cuts (hmmm). A bit too strong on the vinegar, but it was otherwise fine.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Shortly after I wrote my original review, the owner sent me a very nice email with a sincere apology for the unfriendly attitude I had encountered and an assurance that she had spoken to the person about it. This tells me that they do indeed care that their customers have a good experience, so I will look forward to trying them again.
author: Madeline S.

description:
...Very average.  Located directly across the street, it's a haven for Transamerica Building folks looking to fulfill their lunchtime munchies.  From the outside, I always thought it was a full-scale restaurant, table service and all.  But it's rather small, with a walk-up counter; the layout is more conducive to take-out orders.

Prices are on par with other Italian eateries around the FiDi, so you can easily stuff yourself for under $10.  Though not a bad choice for lunch, I'm sure you can find better quality further up in North Beach.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
A great quick and inexpensive lunch. I like the soup and salad combo or the soup and sandwich combo or the salad and 1/2 sandwich combo. I have not tried the pizza, but it looks and smells pretty good. The minestrone isn't the greatest (it's not bad, just not the greatest), but it is vegan. I'm always happy to find a place that makes vegetarian soup. The white bean soup is really good, though. I'm partial to the house salad, which is greens, cherry tomatoes, and goat cheese with a balsamic vinaigrette. My friend/co-worker prefers the feta salad. Our biggest complaint at Tricolore is that they provide too much bread. It's not that the bread is bad; quite the contrary. The problem is that we feel obligated to eat it, and just don't need those extra calories. You can see the dilemma here, right?

The staff is friendly and the order line moves quickly.
author: Allyson V.

description: My co-worker introduced me to her favorite secret Italian lunch spot. Good selection of pizza, pasta salad and sandwiches. We decided to go healthy and both ordered the soup and salad combo for $5. I tried the minestrone and she had the white bean. I think the white bean soup looked better. I enjoyed the cherry tomatoes in our salad - really sweet and juicy!
author: Helen Y.

description:
This tiny cafe does everything to make sure you know it's an Italian eatery.

I found the pizza to be very good. The ingredients were fresh and the cheese and toppings seemed to be of high quality. The pizza melted in my mouth as I took a bite.  The sauce was good but slightly watery from the fresh tomatoes. The crust was light and they crisped it up for me.

There wasn't much time for cleaning, but a nice small place to go for lunch.
author: Chad O.

description: Very delicious!, I had their prawn gamberi and it was very fresh and delicious. The portion is just right. It's a small restaurant but very quaint and quiet.
author: Linda L.

description: A little disappointed that they messed up my catering order yesterday for a board meeting. They forgot to include the dessert that I had already paid for. When I followed up to alert them, Joe was kind enough to reverse the charge and apologized for the mistake. Given that I've ordered from them before it would of been nice if he threw in a little something more as an incentive to entice me to order from them again, especially since a tip was given in advance.
author: Carmina B.

description: This is one of the few places downtown where you can get pasta for relatively cheap. It helps that you order at the counter and don't have to pay a tip. They also have a selection of salads and soups and pizza. I remember it as good, but not good enough to rush to go back. In fact in working downtown for 6 years I only went here once.
author: Kathleen M.

description: Had pasta there, it was good, but I like Cafe Vivoli's pasta more.  Cafe Vivoli is just so delicious.
author: Michael E.

description: Love the sandwiches with home-made foccacia bread!!  It is SO GOOD.  I loved the fresh mozzarella, roma tomatoes, fresh basil, olive oil and black pepper (mozzarella sandwich).  The salads are good too and the prices are VERY REASONABLE and lunch friendly!!  Wasn't too big on their cookies...kinda flakey-ish crumbly texture?  Not my style, but their paninis are BOMB and catering service is reputable.
author: Dee H.

description: This is a real convenient and close place next to my work. I swung by to get a late lunch and came in at 3:55, with 5 minutes to spare and the gentlemen there still served me, he was very nice. The salads are good and the pizza are tasty, however the prosciutto sandwich was a bit bland. But none the less, great place to grab lunch if you work around the financial or North Beach area.
author: Tam T.

description:
I really shouldn't write reviews because I get so sentimental about the places I go for lunch. I guess working in the same block of SF for so long, that's bound to happen. In any case, one of the places I am really attached to is TriColore. The food isn't always the most amazing- I'd like to see at least one more ingridient in the salata della casa- maybe red onion? And the pasta salads need a sprinkle of salt and pepper on occassion, but the pizza is delicious- the simpler the toppings, the better. And the soups are fantastic! I am in love with their split pea and their butternut squash soups. 

Plus, the guys here are nice, remember your face, and go the extra mile. Once when their credit card swiping machine was broken and I didn't have cash, they wrote my first name on my receipt and taped it to the wall and just told me to come back some time and pay it when I had cash or the machine was fixed- which I did the next week just because they were so great about it. They could have lost that seven bucks and I could have walked away with a free meal, but finding that kind of hometown friendliness in the middle of the financial district made my day. 

You can tell the food is homemade. Just like your momma's cooking- not always five stars, but always authentic and made by a real person, with fresh ingridients. A step up from a hole in the wall, but small enough to feel like you've escaped the chain sandwich stores, TriColore rocks- especially early or later than the typical lunch crowd, when the place is all yours. Did I mention they have gelato and great chocolate-dipped shortbread cookies. yeah.
author: Mindy S.

description: Mike, the owner has always treated me like family... Honestly my favorite place in the world for fresh, healthy paninis! Try the smoked salmon one, its my favorite!
author: Maria A.

description:
One of my go-to places for lunch in the area.  Easy, because it's just across the street from the office.  Typically go there when the clock hits 2:00 and I realize I have yet to each lunch.  Or even once, when it was 3:50 and I still hadn't eaten.  But sometimes, I go there because I have a random craving for the salmon focaccia sandwich, and that was pretty much all I ate.  That is, until I discovered their pasta salads.  The tuna pasta salad is great.  The pasta with the tomato and mozzarella is also good.  And I haven't had any trouble asking for extra tomatoes or whatever.  Even in the tuna salad which doesn't come with tomatoes.  And they always smile like they recognize me, which is nice.

Oh anyway, that time I ran over there for lunch at 3:50, by that time, all I had to choose from was pizza or a turkey pesto sandwich.  I went with the sandwich, even though I don't like pesto.  Or at least I thought I didn't.  How fortuitous!  Turns out I find pesto rather tasty.  Thank you to TriColore for expanding my palate.
author: spiff e.

description:
A quick, delicious, and not too expensive lunch. I had a salad and the greens were very fresh and crisp. None of that pale white/green lettuce garbage in this salad. It's all dark green lettuce - the nutritious stuff.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
*3.5 stars*

First visit in AGES (first visit was pre-Yelp)...  

... went with a craving for pizza.  The slice w/ pepperoni (but upon tasting, was more like linguica-YUM!) w/ mushrooms and garlic caught my eye... they warmed it up (wow!  just for me?!) and I was on my merry way to scarf it all up in record time back in the lunch room.  

Tasty tasty!  Good crust, good amount of garlic, sausage was also good and so were the sauteed mushrooms.  

I'm looking forward to going back and trying their panini, salads and soups...
author: Christine T.

description: This place is absolutely amazing! Everything they have is good.  I walk here all the way from Montgomery and Market just for their Panini.  They have great pasta's and salad's as well.  I loooove their bread too! It's the same bread they make their panini's on and they give you a bunch for your pasta's.  A co-worker of mine told me about this place and said it was the best Italian food he's had, ever since then me and some others have been coming here for lunch and we've never had a problem.
author: Christina O.

description:
I eat Tricolore at least once a week and it doesn't disappoint. The sandwiches are placed on warm Focaccia bread and come with greens, thinly sliced ham, olive oil, and other fresh ingredients. 

I tend to order a half sandwich(they are large) and a side creaser for  lunch but I have ventured into the pizzas and pastas. The pasta here is always great but i found the pizza to be too hard and salty for my taste. 

Overall a nice, inexpensive place to get lunch that is on the healthy and fresh side.
author: Nerd A.

description:
If you are looking for a good focaccia sandwich, soup and salad then this is the place to go. Whether it is to go or to stay, I found them to be quick and efficient. Their house salad has a decent amount of goat cheese and cherry tomatoes. I have also had their turkey focaccia and it was big enough for 2 lunches. Also had their lentil soup and was good too. 
It usually never fails. One item on the menu/display that was unusual was swiss bichermuesli which is not something you see everyday. Yet to try it but kudos for selling it.
author: Florencia P.

description:
Upon getting additional feedback from coworkers, they felt that the pasta to sauce ratio was too high (e.g. not enough sauce). Fair point, but the way I see it is...it's because people are used to what I call the American-style of Italian food. So - I reiterate...order from here if you like light (more) authentic Italian quick cuisine/good catering. 

I would still order from Tricolore for an office event becauce frankly, it's a lot cleaner (because there isn't crazy greasy sauce spilling everywhere), works better with our budget, it's healthy and people loved the salad.
author: Cat T.

description:
SO GOOD!  For five bucks, the authetic Italians will serve you salads, lasagana, pizzas, soups, pastas or any combination thereof.   Genuine, like mama used to make! 

Textured walls contribute to the homey ambiance. The staff is sweet and constant. 

The food is good and you can avoid the lunch crowd by swinging in before 12:30 or after 1:15.
author: Mimi S.

description:
Ideal for lunch.  Everything is good: from the pizza to the paninis to the pasta.  Service is quick and cordial.  The combos offer variety and decent portions.  

The vegetariano is my personal fave.
author: Jamaal C.

description:
The inside provides a nice atmosphere giving it a nice mom & pop sort of atmosphere, and in a way reminded me of Florence.

The selection of pasta, pizza, and other Italian foods all looked great from what I saw, and there's a daily special to keep you coming back looking for something new.

The service is speedy, the staff is friendly, and most importantly the food is quite delectable.  The pasta that I had all the right ingredients that made it just right and very flavorful.  Will come back to this place at a later date.
author: Tien N.

description:
Tricolore is one of the three places I can order-in lunch via my office's you're-not-leaving-your-desk-until-this-crap-gets-done lunch menu service.  I've probably eaten just about everything on the menu several times over.  Two observations stand out from the countless meals eaten at my desk:

One, I love their soups (for a take out lunch place).  Tomato white bean and pure of butternut squash are both healthy and veg/vegan friendly (not that I'd ever say no to a cheese or dairy).  They have a weekly rotation of soups and there is always something good and healthy.

Two, this is the only Italian restaurant in which I've been served bad focaccia.  I just hate their homemade bread, which is saying a lot as I'm a total bread / carb whore.  Seriously, I could live off of a bizzaro-Atkins diet should on be invented (patent pending).  Yet I won't eat the bread at Tricolore because it is bland, sort of woody, and lacking in the classic focaccia flavor or texture.  This is important to know because all sandwiches are made with it too, so I avoid them like cold brussel sprouts served in the morning by Grandma because you refused to eat them the night before.... Um, ignore that last bit, I think I'm over sharing.

Long story short: Solid lunch place, just stick to the soup and pizza.  Other non-sandwich options are nice too.  Very solid place.
author: Aaron M.

description: An odd $3.83 for a slice of pesto.  It was thinnish and very good but small so I find it tough to score against the big typical slice places.  It's a cafe with many options and places to sit and eat.   It's a lunch place in the FIDI so you're paying for the overhead.  Good slice though.
author: Jeff J.

description: I work just around the corner and I liked it there. They have lots of COMBO, soup+salad, piza+salad, piza+soup, etc... I had peparoni * mushroom piza and lentil soup, were pretty good. Overall, average lunch place.
author: Yoko S.

description:
YUMMY! Cute, cozy Italian cafe with all sorts of goodies. My friend took me here while searching for lunch and I instantly found a lot of options. Prices are reasonable and the portions are generous. I love the atmosphere too, it's homey and comfortable. 

There's a big menu for the little restaurant - pizza, pasta entrees, panini, calzone, soup and a variety of salads. I also like how they list prices for combinations so you don't have to wonder if it's going to cost you a fortune. 

I can't wait to come back and try the paninis and pizzas - the ingredients all look very tasty and I can't get enough of prosciutto! They also have breakfast and a full coffee bar with espresso drinks made from organic coffee beans. 

I went with the pasta bolognese and a cup of vegan minestrone soup. The portions were generous and elegant presentation for a to-go order. It was so good and I love how it wasn't too greasy or salty. I'm definitely coming back for more! It's my new favorite lunch spot!
author: Gladys C.

description:
I absolutely LOVE Tri Colore.  I used to work across the street at the pyramid and ate there 3-4 times a week, but now that I'm down on California St., I only make it over there like once a week.  I make the walk because the food is sooooooooooooo good!

I usually get a half of a sandwich (the Tacchino), and ask for it hot.  They put it in the oven so that the cheese melts into perfect yumminess.  I also get a small mediterranean salad which has thick slices of cucumber, tomato, olives and cheese.  Oh it's so tasty!

The staff is so friendly and always smiling.  They will not only remember the faces of their regulars, but also their names.  I am greeted personally each time I go in and even engage in some quick chit chat.  This place is not your average get in, get your food, and get out sort of joint.  It's an absolute gem.
author: lea m.

description:
LOVE their pizzas

pastas are good could be better if the portion was a little bigger

pricey but worth it
author: Annie C.

description: I love the location - as it is in close proximity to my office - and I love their Tricolore salad! YUM. Their pizza is good as well, but I'm more a fan of their salads and soup. The house salad is fresh and I love the dressing. My favorite of their soups is the white bean tomato soup.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
For a quick, convenient lunch downtown, I have found nothing that beats Tricolore.  A REALLY good slice of pizza and a salad (or a slice and half a panini) is only $6.50.  I can't get over how excellent their pizza is.  One of these days I'm going to order an entire pizza....
Truth be told, the only thing I've ever eaten here is the pizza.  But again, it really is excellent, especially in comparison to any other slice you're going to be able to get in the financial district at lunchtime.  The interior is charming, the staff friendly -- a great place for a quick, cheap lunch.
author: p m.

description: I'm doing some training in SF and stopped in for a Panini. They got my order wrong and had the nerve to get irritated with me. I found the cashier to be rude and dismissive. The panini was nothing special, I wouldn't come back here again.
author: Lola P.

description: Had not been here for awhile, my neighbor and I decided to go there for lunch. We ordered pizza and salad, boy was it delicious!!! It was so great to see Jorge! He always has a warm smile for the customers and he's very helpful, should you have any questions. I think I'll make Tricolore a weekly destination!!!
author: Linda A.

description: Absolutely yummy option if you work in the transamerica building. Its right across the street and has tasty pizza, pannini, cold pasta salad, hot pasta, homemade soup, and gelato options to choose from. The lunch combos are decent for the price and everything is fresh and flavorful. I usually walk out with the half sando and small Cesar salad for 7 bucks. Its not bad considering the other options around town will make your ass the size of a small planet and cost way more. The staff is nice and its efficient. Walk in - order - pay - and sit or take it back to the cube. It never takes more than 5 mins to get what I want and beat it.
author: Stacy T.

description: I've been here a lot, and still have a hard time comprehending that you can order something off the menu even if it is not in the big glass case. The pizzas here are very decent. They have fresh squeezed OJ and take credit cards. They have some interesting lunch combos - I am used to only seeing soup/salad and soup/sandwich as a combo. Here, you can have soup/pizza, pizza/sandwich, pizza/salad, salad/sandwich etc. All for around $6. Also, the interior of the restaurant is cute.
author: Sandi Q.

description: YUM!  First time visit was a winner!  Great cafe, smells delicious when you walk in - service is so fast it was hard to believe, and salad was delisH!
author: Irish L.

description: Good pizza and surprisingly great fruit salad.  They were right on time with the delivery, friendly delivery guy.
author: Sherry Z.

description:
this is my favorite secret lunch spot. healthy, fresh and sooo good. 
it's fast and cheap too.
author: Jenny R.

description: Decent. Had a prosciutto panini and some soup for lunch. Not too expensive but not amazing.
author: Brian W.

description: I'm not a fan of the food here.  I wish it was better because it's so conveniently located, but unfortunately it's not that good.  The pizza doesn't taste very good and the pasta is also just mediocre.  If you want pizza I think the best place to go within walking distance of FiDi is Pizza Orgasmica in the Embarcardero Center.
author: Jon N.

description: I went here with a few of my co-workers for lunch one day and it was a nice little place. The atmosphere was casual and laid back. The food was pretty good but not exceptional, worth the price.  I ordered the Tricolore pizza; it was thin and crispy. However, the price was cheap and we did enjoy ourselves.
author: meL Z.

description: One of the few places that is open past 3pm in the financial district, which is great when yuo can't quite get to lunch on time. Their foccacia sandwiches are decent, I like the chicken one because of the carmelized onions in it, but the chicken is kinda dry... the guys that work there are great. Super friendly and good at remembering repeat customers. Salads are fresh too, the goat cheese in the mixed greens is REALLY good, but I dont really like their dressing, lacks flavor. The pizza is not bad, not golden boys, but still good :)
author: Marina K.

description:
my co-worker took me here for lunch for a salad and panini special and i was in love.  their house salad is really fresh with perfectly ripe tomatoes and the cheese is so creamy and delicious.  i especially like the dressing because the basalmic vinaigrette was just that, a vinaigrette.  i'm getting a bit annoyed with restaurants that serve a creamy basalmic vinaigrette.

i had the tacchino panini which is roasted turkey, spinach, provolone, tomatoes, and pesto.  it was so tasty and had so much flavor.  

what a great place to have lunch.
author: Kristine S.

description: Tricolore is the business!  I just had their cheese ravioli with pesto.  It took awhile for it to be made, but it was totally worth the wait.  I've been there on other occasion for lunch and the rest of their food is great.  If you work in the FiDi, I highly recommend this place.
author: Melanie B.

description: I have had lunch here a few times, and the pizza just hits the spot. I wasn't a big fan of the sandwiches though.
author: Prasant R.

description: Everyone always raves about North beach and their Italian cuisine supremacy here in San Francisco. Tricolore Cafe & Pizzeria serves as ample proof that you do not have to venture into the want-to-be areas of NB in order ot get first rate italian fare. If the wonderful aroma does not get you, their excellent variety of sandwiches, salads, pastas and divine pizza certainly will. The staff treats you like family, and I like that feeling. I have eaten lunch here on several occasions and each time was put into a trance by the flavors. At last, a cafe that believes in an overabundance of garlic and fresh herbs. Bucca de Beppo and Olive Garden fans, stay in North Beach. The ones in the know come to Tricolore to eat real Italian food.
author: Kenny G.

description: Awesome service! Get delivery once a week for work and they are ALWAYS on time, Can personalize the order to fit the needs of our group. WE love the salads with Chicken!!!  Have tried to find other places like it with delivery but none compare to Tricolore. Huge portions too!
author: L. M.

description: We catered a lunch from these guys today, it was average and for the price a little disappointing. The pasta salad and fruit salad (fresh fruit, yum) were really good, so that saved them a star. But, the pizza was cold when it got here, yuck! The antipasto platter was average but the focaccia bread that came with it was the biggest hit! Unfortunately I would probably not order catering from them again, the prices were just too high for the quality of the food.
author: Kristin D.

description: When my office moved approximately 1 1/2 blocks (in the real world) and straight from funk to celene dion (in my world), my saving grace was:"Maybe this will force me to find new lunch spots/ sneaky cocktail joints". So far I've got double vodka martinis from Alfred's (Huzzah!), and snarling, poo under the nose attitude at Palio Paniyucky (Boo!). Luckily, we are still in spitting distance from Bocadillo (lamb burger)and Tricolore. Here is what I do @ TC: order two salads: tuna pasta and mediteranneo, which is cukes. tomato and feta, in one container to go. It's like $6.50.  Mix the lot w/ the vinagrette. Eat. I know it seems obvious, but a girls gotta eat, so I've heard.
author: David M.

description: This is a regular lunch spot for me since it's just around the corner from my office. The food is quick, service good and everything I've had so far is very tasty. Their minnestrone soup is my favorite item and I usually get it with a side salad of fruit or something. The portions are good and it's really cheap. They've got a nice variety of pasta salads to choose from as well as a cesar that looks ok but I have yet to try. I've tried a few of their hot dishes, all were good, the pizza is only so-so though so I'd stick with their pasta, soups and salads instead.
author: Audrey V.

description: One of my weekly pit stops for lunch although I always order the same thing. The soup and 1/2 panini combo is a great deal and I have no compliants thus far. The chicken panini, my choice du -every-jour rocks. Outside of that, I have no idea what the rest of the food is like. My buddy thought the pizza's were weak so maybe not everything is a hit at this place.
author: Jonny Bobby G.

description: Great food - lots of variety, pizza, panini, salads, soup, pastas, and daily/weekly specials. Not a lot of space for dining - there are some tabels inside and outside. But it's got a good vibe and is a great lunch spot. Last week I had a great greek salad and a slice of chicken pizza. Very tasty - filled me up well. And the lines moves really fast which is key for us "take lunch back to the office" people.
author: Emily L.

description: I went there yesterday and ordered the chicken lasagna and the penna pasta with chicken. Not bad for under $7.00 for lunch. The pizza is pretty good but if you like it crispy ask them to cook it longer and tell them well done.
author: Steve w.

description: Say hello to my new go-to lunch time pasta joint.  In the hood I've tried Gio's and Mangia Tutti.  Gio's is ok as a sit-down/table service spot, but nothing special.  Mangia Tutti is wonderful but only if the boss is paying.  Tricolore, on the other (third?) hand, just served up a plate of awesome penne con pollo in a tasty, garlic-y tomato sauce, plus a can of coke, for $9.  The pizzas and sandwiches looked pretty damn good, too, and the service is super fast.  It's pretty much the perfect counter service Italian joint.
author: Steve G.

description:
Luv this little deli. Delicious panini's, the best caesar salad, and yummy pizza...

I gave it four stars because sometimes they charge you incorrectly if your not careful, and because it can be a bit pricey- half a panini and half a salad with a drink is around $9... but the food is delicious and the only decent place nearby...
author: Vic M.

description: Great place to go for vegan soups. They always have minestrone and switch out the other one. The pizza and pasta are okay.
author: Molly B.

description: the only thing i don't like about this place is when they don't make or run out of vegan pizza slices, the latter normally happens when i decide lunch should occur at 2pm or later. damn you work for making me work! hey they have vegan soups which are tasty and the pizza crusts are thin, crisp and fak'n great! i'm down! woo-hoo!
author: mike t.

description: mediocre salad and pasta, tasty pizza, but i think i'll stick with orgasmica in the embarcadero center
author: Jared Z.

description: Tricolore is not the best Italian food . The lasagna needs work, for starters. But it is really good for a pizza & soup fix. Yes, I like pizza and soup together. I like how their pizza slice comes out of the oven slightly crispy.  Also, the pasta is yummy when you ask for the white and red sauces mixed together. Unless you are looking for something altogether gourmet, this is a spot that will do just fine for a lunch break.
author: Niya M.
